00049 //
00050 // AnchorTextAnnotator
00051 //
00052 // 25 May 2004 -- tds
00053 //
00054 // Reads anchor text in from files created by the 
00055 // combiner, and adds the text to the end of the
00056 // parsed document
00057 //
00058 
00059 #ifndef INDRI_ANCHORTEXTANNOTATOR_HPP
00060 #define INDRI_ANCHORTEXTANNOTATOR_HPP
00061 
00062 #include "indri/Buffer.hpp"
00063 #include "indri/Transformation.hpp"
00064 #include <iostream>
00065 #include "indri/TagExtent.hpp"
00066 #include "indri/ParsedDocument.hpp"
00067 #include <fstream>
00068 
00069 class AnchorTextAnnotator : public Transformation {
00070   std::ifstream _in;
00071   char _docno[256];
00072   int _count;
00073   Buffer _buffer;
00074   ObjectHandler<ParsedDocument>* _handler;
00075 
00076   void _readDocumentHeader() {
00077     char line[65536];
00078 
00079     if( !_in.good() || _in.eof() )
00080       return;
00081 
00082     // DOCNO=
00083     _in.getline( _docno, sizeof _docno-1 );
00084     // DOCURL=
00085     _in.getline( line, sizeof line-1 );
00086 
00087     // LINKS=
00088     _in.getline( line, sizeof line-1 );
00089     _count = atoi( line+6 );
00090   }
00091 
00092   void _fetchText( greedy_vector<TagExtent>& tags, greedy_vector<char*>& terms ) {
00093     // first, surround current text with a mainbody tag
00094     TagExtent mainbody;
00095     mainbody.begin = 0;
00096     mainbody.end = terms.size();
00097     mainbody.name = "mainbody";
00098     mainbody.number = 0;
00099 
00100     greedy_vector<TagExtent> oldTags;
00101     oldTags = tags;
00102     tags.clear();
00103     tags.push_back( mainbody );
00104     tags.append( oldTags.begin(), oldTags.end() );
00105 
00106     // now, fetch the additional terms
00107     char line[65536];
00108     _buffer.clear();
00109 
00110     for( int i=0; i<_count; i++ ) {
00111       // LINK
00112       _in.getline( line, sizeof line-1 );
00113 
00114       // TEXT=
00115       _in.getline( line, sizeof line-1 );
00116       int textLen = strlen(line+6);
00117       strcpy( _buffer.write(textLen+1), line+6 );
00118       _buffer.unwrite(1);
00119 
00120       assert( *(_buffer.front()+_buffer.position()-1) == '\"' && "Last character should be a quote" );
00121     }
00122     *(_buffer.write(1)) = 0;
00123 
00124     // now there's a bunch of text in _buffer, space separated, with each
00125     // link separated by a " symbol
00126 
00127     char* beginWord = 0;
00128     int beginIndex = 0;
00129     char* buffer = _buffer.front();
00130 
00131     for( unsigned int i=0; i<_buffer.position(); i++ ) {
00132       if( isalnum(buffer[i]) && !beginWord ) {
00133         beginWord = buffer+i;
00134 
00135         if(!beginIndex)
00136           beginIndex = terms.size();
00137       } else if( isspace(buffer[i]) ) {
00138         if( beginWord )
00139           terms.push_back( beginWord );
00140         buffer[i] = 0;
00141         beginWord = 0;
00142       } else if( buffer[i] == '\"' ) {
00143         buffer[i] = 0;
00144         if( beginWord )
00145           terms.push_back( beginWord );
00146         beginWord = 0;
00147         
00148         TagExtent extent;
00149         extent.name = "inlink";
00150         extent.begin = beginIndex;
00151         extent.end = terms.size();
00152         extent.number = 0;
00153 
00154         assert( extent.begin <= extent.end );
00155 
00156         if( beginIndex )
00157           tags.push_back(extent);
00158 
00159         beginIndex = 0;
00160       }
00161     }
00162   }
00163 
00164   bool _matchingDocno( ParsedDocument* document ) {
00165     // find DOCNO attribute in document
00166     for( size_t i=0; i<document->metadata.size(); i++ ) {
00167       const char* attributeName = document->metadata[i].key;
00168       const char* attributeValue = (const char*) document->metadata[i].value;
00169 
00170       if( !strcmp( attributeName, "docno" ) ) {
00171         if( !strcmp( attributeValue, _docno+6 ) ) {
00172           return true;
00173         } else {
00174           return false;
00175         }
00176       }
00177     }
00178  
00179     return false;
00180   }
00181 
00182 public:
00183   AnchorTextAnnotator() {
00184     _handler = 0;
00185   }
00186 
00187   ~AnchorTextAnnotator() {
00188     _in.close();
00189   }
00190 
00191   void open( const std::string& anchorFile ) {
00192     _in.close();
00193     _in.clear();
00194     _in.open( anchorFile.c_str() );
00195     _buffer.clear();
00196     _readDocumentHeader();
00197   }
00198 
00199   ParsedDocument* transform( ParsedDocument* document ) {
00200     if( _matchingDocno( document ) ) {
00201       _fetchText( document->tags, document->terms );
00202       _readDocumentHeader();
00203     }
00204   
00205     return document;
00206   }
00207 
00208   void setHandler( ObjectHandler<ParsedDocument>& handler ) {
00209     _handler = &handler;
00210   }
00211 
00212   void handle( ParsedDocument* document ) {
00213     _handler->handle( transform( document ) );
00214   }
00215 };
00216 
00217 #endif // INDRI_ANCHORTEXTANNOTATOR_HPP
